lender.name: Mary
lender.loan_because:
I believe in helping people to pursue their dreams. I am studying Judaism and in the religion there is the concept of Tzedakah. The word "tzedakah" is derived from the Hebrew root Tzadei-Dalet-Qof, meaning righteousness, justice or fairness, giving is not viewed as a generous, magnanimous act; it is simply an act of justice and righteousness, the performance of a duty, giving those in need their due.
Certain kinds of tzedakah are considered more meritorious than others. The Talmud describes these different levels of tzedakah, and Rambam organized them into a list. The levels of charity, from the least meritorious to the most meritorious, are:
Giving begrudgingly Giving less that you should, but giving it cheerfully. Giving after being asked Giving before being asked Giving when you do not know the recipient's identity, but the recipient knows your identity Giving when you know the recipient's identity, but the recipient doesn't know your identity Giving when neither party knows the other's identity Enabling the recipient to become self-reliant
I love kiva because it is all about helping people become self-reliant!

lender.occupational_info: We are children who attend child care in Bonnie's home while our parents are at work.

lender.name: Robert
lender.loan_because: I feel that this is an even better way of helping people in need than donating to charity. It helps people grow rather than patching problems temporarily with short term aid. Borrowers are required to document how the loan helped them. Also, the microfinancing institutions are actually interviewing borrowers face to face and appropriately assessing risk. This is something banks in the US neglected to do and is one of the reasons we faced a recession. I loan because I think Kiva and the microfinancing institutions have stepped in and filled a huge hole in the way capital is disbursed. They are giving directly to small businesses. In the US right now the way we do this is we give a lot of money to the big banks and cross our fingers and hope that they will give to small businesses. If they don't then we try to regulate them. Kiva is addressing need directly at the source of the problem. I like it!
lender.occupational_info: I write computer programs that make it easier for people to find information about companies in financial databases. It is similar to implementing Google for the financial industry.

lender.name: Jessica
lender.loan_because: As the team Ranchers helping Ranchers put it ranching and raising animals on small and family farms should be treasured and protected. I am 5th generation (with 6th coming up) born & raised on a working cattle & sheep ranch. I know how hard and rewarding a life on the land is and want to help support others doing the same in the developing world.
lender.occupational_info: In the 1870âs three ranchers (one being my great-great grandfather) married three sisters. From the first generation until today these families have maintained close social ties and helped with each others ranch work and supported each other in time of need. We currently graze cattle and in the past sheep. When we had sheep, our sheepherders came from Peru & Mexico through a work exchange. What they earned helping our family with the sheep would often support an entire village back home. Eventfully we had to sell out of the sheep related to a declining meat & wool market. There is also a lot of pressure to get grazing animals off public lands and we were in fear of losing our grazing allotment. Kiva is a nice way to give back to the people we were once close to. As with most farming and ranching an outside income is often needed to secure the safety of the operation in bad years. With this in mind I became a nurse and recently a Nurse Practitioner. Rural healthcare both here in America and in the developing world is a passion of mine. During my nurse practitioner training I was able to travel to Benin, West Africa, and spend time at The Songhai Center run by local people teaching sustainable agriculture and health care. I worked on a project at the center to manufacture & sell at reasonable price ceramic water filters that families could have in their homes to allow for clean/safe drinking & cooking water. I fell in love with the passion and closeness to the land the African people had and found that I often had more in common with them then most Americans.

Carrots are for rabbits. I and my team will provide great feeds.

lender.loan_because: We want to see the world prosper. We wish for the end of suffering for all sentient beings. The only way that we can all prosper is if people of both genders are able to contribute to human betterment. We loan because we want people to realize their dreams.
lender.occupational_info:
Kris supervises a small cafe inside of a bookstore. There are about seven workers that she supervises. I make sure that there are plenty of products to serve customers and keep them happy. Customer service is a big deal for Kris; she makes sure that we remember our regular customers by name, as well as the drink that they like. She cleans the cafe, orders supplies, trains new workers, and sets up nice-looking displays of products.
Kim is currently managing the household, which consists of Kris, Kim, and Kim's parents John and Gail...as well as two cats. Kim does laundry, cooks great meals, cleans up the house, and has developed a compost thing to help make potable soil for a garden next spring. Nevada doesn't have the best soil; it's more like sand. So, Kim has used her expertise to develop this compost system to make soil in which our food will thrive and make us less-dependent on outside sources. We plan to launch our organic garden in early 2010.

lender.name: Reclaimed Hope
lender.loan_because: I believe in empowering women. An empowered woman can bring about change in her life; in the lives of her family members, her community and the world.
lender.occupational_info: I am an artist who loves creating something out of nothing. Making paper, finding recycled objects and turning them into art gives me great joy. Turning profits from the sale of my art into microloans thru kiva.org brings me even greater joy.

lender.name: Yair Flicker
lender.loan_because: I hope it'll help
lender.occupational_info: I help create software and websites that makes companies operate more efficiently.

lender.name: Chelsea
lender.loan_because: I believe small contributions can create a thriving worlds

lender.name: Franz
lender.loan_because: I believe that people do not want a free ride. I believe that an individual can alleviate his economic condition with a little support from their fellow man. Sometimes "free stuff" diminishes the value of a man. While a loan that is repaid increases self worth and belief in self.
lender.occupational_info: Social Consciousness and action.

lender.name: Jane
lender.loan_because: It's the right thing to do.
lender.occupational_info: I am a writer and a teacher.

lender.name: Cathryn
lender.loan_because: It's the right thing to do.

lender.name: Nancy
lender.whereabouts: Kingston upon Hull East Riding of Yorkshire
lender.loan_because: I want to help small businesses, especially for women, and especially in Mexico, Central and South America. My son and family live in Mexico, and my husband and I drove from Boston to Buenos Aires in 1963. I have strong memories of the good people we met, and the serious poverty.
lender.occupational_info: I work as a psychotherapist, basically helping unhappy people feel happier. Sometimes this involves fighting injustices which are the cause of their problems. I also teach piano to beginners, especially adults who always wanted to learn and never got round to it.

lender.name: Vanessa & Ryan
lender.loan_because: butterfly wings start the tornado.
lender.occupational_info: Our work is loving our daughter, Sydney, in small-town Alaska. Vanessa works for a local non-profit and Ryan does construction.

lender.name: Cherie
lender.loan_because: loans help people get their feet on the ground for the long term not just a gift for today.
lender.occupational_info: I coordinate a state grant that provides social and educational activities for deaf and hard of hearing children and other services, such as interpreter training.

lender.name: SFGAlexandria
lender.occupation: an Edgar Cayce Search for God group
lender.loan_because: It makes sense in many ways.
lender.occupational_info: We meet once a week to discuss books, among others by and about Edgar Cayce.

lender.name: Ryan
lender.loan_because: give a man a fish he can eat for a day, teach a man to fish and he can feed his family for life, yadda yadda yadda...
lender.occupational_info: Container Shipping

lender.name: Ira
lender.loan_because: My niece asked me to as she is working with Kiva.
lender.occupational_info: Advertising, graphic design, website design.

lender.name: Terry
lender.loan_because: We must share ourselves for the benefit of others because everybody deserves the opportunity to succeed. This will promote peace.

lender.name: Ductz of Chicago
lender.loan_because: we want to give back for each client that has us improve their indoor air.
lender.occupational_info: Indoor air professionals.

lender.name: Malin
lender.loan_because: I love this idea to be able to help others
lender.occupational_info: I take care of kids and teenagers in school.

lender.name: Kate
lender.loan_because: Sarvesam Mangalam Bhavatu~Prosperity be unto all.

lender.name: Liviu
lender.loan_because: Somebody needs this money more than me

lender.name: Sheila
lender.loan_because: I love to help people. It is rewarding to see their progress being made with their business. Namaste
lender.occupational_info: I work with paper and electronic health records. Ensure data is accurate and that the records meet certain standards.

lender.name: Jennifer
lender.loan_because: By loaning, the small amount I can afford can go much farther to make a real difference than if I were just to donate.
lender.occupational_info: I am a homecare nurse that makes visits to the elderly, recently hospitalized patients, and others at their homes that need help learning about heir medications, wound care, or other medical needs.

lender.name: Jill
lender.loan_because: I admire people working hard to get ahead. I was helped financially once and it made a huge difference to my life. I'm happy to have the opportunity to do the same for someone else.
lender.occupational_info: I work in film production and I use computers for graphic layouts.

lender.name: Rhenea
lender.loan_because: God is so good to me, I am blessed and want to bless others. People helping people that's a beautiful world
lender.occupational_info: I am a student working toward my BSN Bachelors in Nursing Science

lender.name: Mike
lender.loan_because: share the wealth, help the poor!!

lender.name: Tim
lender.loan_because: It is an easy way to fight poverty.

lender.name: Cameron
lender.occupational_info: I'm an undergraduate student at the University of Tennessee studying biochemistry, cellular, and molecular biology, and I am hopefully going to medical school in the next couple of years. I am also involved in various research projects involving protein structure and reactivity at UT.

lender.name: Matthew Miller
lender.loan_because: Putting a dream in action lets it become a dream again.
lender.occupational_info: I like to think that what I do helps others to use their voice and in doing so helps me find my own.

lender.name: Wendy
lender.loan_because: As an atheist, I believe we have to help each other as human beings. I want to help people who are already helping themselves and others. My goal is to provide support to entrepreneurs in developing nations and also women's empowerment programs.
lender.occupational_info: I work in finance and with entrepreneurs everyday in America, and I want to help small business owners and hard working people to be successful and improve lives all across the globe.

lender.name: Andrew
lender.loan_because: The best way to reduce poverty is to give determined individuals a chance at making a better life.

lender.name: John
lender.loan_because: It's a way to help those in need AND I actually get to see where the money is going. It's an even better bonus that we get the money back and then loan it to someone else.
lender.occupational_info: I am blessed to put people in better situations and Kiva gives me an opportunity for me to make yet another difference in a life.

lender.name: Josh & Brandi
lender.loan_because: We loand because we want to make a difference in peoples lifes.
lender.occupational_info: Right now we are in college, trying to earn a college degree.

lender.name: Sylvia
lender.loan_because: It gives hope and provides life to others.
lender.occupational_info: I raise awareness for social justice for oppressed women and children. I also raise money for projects that will aid and assist communities where women and children live.

lender.name: mauricioQuest
lender.loan_because: We need help to improve the state of art in ours development platforms and to create distribution channels besides Colombia and Venezuela.
lender.occupational_info: We develop interactive virtual reality, and augmented reality platforms using free engines with outstanding quality work and very competitive prices

lender.name: Sonja
lender.loan_because: I care.

lender.name: Gilroy Family
lender.loan_because: It's the right thing to do to give people a hand up.
lender.occupational_info: I stare at spreadsheets. Alllllll day.

lender.name: Denver-Nairobi Sister Cities
lender.loan_because:
Denver, Colorado and Nairobi, Kenya established a Sister Cities partnership on March 2, 1975. The mission of Denver Sister Cities International is to promote peace through mutual respect, understanding and cooperation with cultural, educational and economic endeavors. Through more than 30 years, the Denver-Nairobi Committee has been dedicated to promoting economic achievements, cultural exchanges, and cross-cultural learning opportunities.
The Denver-Nairobi Committee is excited and honored to be participating in micro-credit lending to individuals strengthening their lives and communities in Kenya.
lender.occupational_info: Denver and Nairobi are both bustling modern capitols, with international air, diverse populations and nearby snow-topped peaks. Nairobi, like Denver, is situated on a high plateau with two of the highest peaks in Africa a relatively short distance away. Nairobi is an exciting and cosmopolitan city and, as the capitol of Kenya, serves as a center of commerce for all of East Africa. Like the "Queen City of the Plains," Nairobi is a beautiful city and has often been referred to as the "Jewel of Africa."

lender.name: Homer
lender.occupational_info: Fundraising

lender.name: Ephesus Community
lender.loan_because: Matthew 22:37-40

lender.name: Erin
lender.loan_because: I want to be a part of the bigger picture and help others, help themselves
